comment.text: Transcriptional regulator that associates with ribosomal RNA promoters and suppresses ribosomal RNA (rRNA) transcription.
Interacts with UBTF. Interacts with the NuRD complex component RBBP4 (via the nucleolar localization motif), the interaction mediates transcriptional repression activity.
Nuclear, it particularly localizes to the nucleolus.
The PHD-type zinc finger 1 mediates both nucleolar localization and interaction with UBTF.

The ePHD2 domain folds as an integrated structural module comprizing the C2HC pre-PHD-type 2 zinc finger and the PHD-type 2 zinc finger. It mediates non-specific binding to dsDNA, but doesn't bind histones in contrast to many PHD-type zinc fingers.

disease.name: Boerjeson-Forssman-Lehmann syndrome
disease.description: An X-linked recessive disorder characterized by moderate to severe mental retardation, epilepsy, hypogonadism, hypometabolism, obesity with marked gynecomastia, swelling of subcutaneous tissue of the face, narrow palpebral fissure and large but not deformed ears.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Expressed in female gonad and 221 other tissues
F:DNA-binding transcription repressor activity, RNA polymerase II-specific
P:negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

feature.description: Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2)
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2)
